conclusion: The v-t graphs represent two objects, A and B, moving in the same direction along a straight line.

Object B's velocity is represented by the lower curve on the v-t graph.

conclusion: From the start (t = 0) until the instant t₁, object A’s velocity is larger than object B’s at every moment.

premise: From the start (t = 0) until the instant t₁, object A’s velocity is larger than object B’s at every moment.
conclusion: The instantaneous difference v_A − v_B is always positive.
The displacement difference Δs(t) equals the time-integral of the velocity difference: Δs(t) = ∫₀ᵗ [v_A(τ) − v_B(τ)] dτ.
